taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek chalepaino , term used by Theophrastus probably in connection with weedy plants; some authors believe it derived from Arabic Haleb (erroneously rendered Chaleb by some), name for the Syrian city Aleppo, but highly unlikely since Adanson based it on Bauhin’s Myagrum monospermum minus , collected in southern France]

bio:treatment.discussion: Calepina cochlearioides (Murray) Dumortier is distributed in Asia (China, Kazakhstan, Mongolia, and adjacent Russia).

references.reference: Blake, S. F. 1957. A new cruciferous weed, Calepina irregularis, in Virginia. Rhodora 59: 278–280.
Hardin, J. W. 1958. Calepina irregularis in North Carolina. Castanea 23: 111.
